top_categories.workout_context: Monaco Gravel Race’s monaco/french alps gravel (70%), paved roads (30%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Monaco Gravel Race isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Monaco Gravel Race — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Monaco Gravel Race when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Monaco Gravel Race rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Monaco Gravel Race’s monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Monaco Gravel Race’s 8,202ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Monaco Gravel Race — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Monaco Gravel Race. Make this intensity feel like home.
Monaco Gravel Race’s monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Monaco Gravel Race count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Monaco Gravel Race’s 8,202ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Monaco Gravel Race’s 68 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Monaco Gravel Race demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: monaco/french alps gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), steep climbs. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 68 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Critical Power to prepare you for 68 miles of monaco/french alps—steep technical climbs in Monaco.
